edu.iastate.cs228.hw5

Class SplayTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • edu.iastate.cs228.hw5.SplayTree<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.Set<E>

    public class SplayTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
extends java.util.AbstractSet<E>
    This class implements a splay tree. Add any helper methods or implementation details you'd like to include.

      • addBST

        public boolean addBST(E data)
        Adds an element to the tree without splaying.
        The method carries out a binary search tree addition.
        It is used for initialize a splay tree.
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:

      • add

        public boolean add(E data)
        Inserts an element into the splay tree.
        In case the element was not contained, this creates a new node and splays the tree at the new node.
        If the element exists in the tree already, it splays at the node containing the element.
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Collection<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Set<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
        Overrides:
        add in class java.util.AbstractCollection<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
        Parameters:
        data - element to be inserted
        Returns:
        true if addition takes place false otherwise (i.e., data is in the tree already)

      • contains

        public boolean contains(E data)
        Determines whether the tree contains an element.
        Splays at the Node that stores the element.
        If the element is not found, splays at the last Node on the search path.
        Parameters:
        data - element to be determined whether to exist in the tree
        Returns:
        true if the element is contained in the tree and false otherwise

      • remove

        public boolean remove(E data)
        Removes the Node that stores an element.
        Splays at its parent Node after removal. (No splay if the removed Node was the root)
        If the Node was not found, the last Node encountered on the search path is splayed to the root.
        Parameters:
        data - element to be removed from the tree
        Returns:
        true if the object is removed false if it was not contained in the tree

      • splay

        public void splay(E data)
        Finds the node that stores the data and splays at it.
        Parameters:
        data -

      • findElement

        public E findElement(E data)

      • findEntry

        public SplayTree.Node findEntry(E data)
        Finds the node that stores an item. It is called by contains(), add(), and splay().
        Parameters:
        data - item to be searched
        Returns:
        node if found or the last node on the search path otherwise null if size == 0.

      • join

        public SplayTree.Node join(SplayTree.Node root1,
                           SplayTree.Node root2)
        Join the two subtrees T1 and T2 rooted at root1 and root2 into one. It is called by remove(). Precondition: All datas in T1 are less than those in T2. Access the largest data in T1, and splay at the Node to make it the root of T1.
        Make T2 the right subtree of T1. The method is called by remove().
        Parameters:
        root1 - root of the subtree T1
        root2 - root of the subtree T2
        Returns:
        the root of the joined subtree

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Write the splay tree according to the format specified below (also read Section 2.2 of the project description). 1. Every Node of the tree occupies a separate line with its data written only. 2. The data stored at a Node at depth d is printed with indentation 4d (i.e., preceded by 4d blanks). 3. Start with the root (at depth 0) and display the nodes in a preorder traversal. More specifically, suppose a Node n is shown at line l. Then, starting at line l+1, 3a) recursively print all nodes in the left subtree (if any) of n; 3b) recursively print all nodes in the right subtree (if any) of n. 4. If a Node has a left child but no right child, print its right child as null. 5. If a Node has a right child but no left child, print its left child as null. 6. If a Node is a leaf, print it with no further recursion. Use an iterator.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.util.AbstractCollection<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
